| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 905](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L905) |

A **goblin outrider**, o, is a type of monster that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is somewhat stronger than a regular [goblin](/wiki/Goblin "Goblin").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [1.1 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly-generated goblin-outriders can generate in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"), and may be peaceful towards [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters.

A goblin outrider has a 1⁄3 chance each of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") of the following: an [orcish cloak](/wiki/Orcish_cloak "Orcish cloak"), a stack of [orcish spears](/wiki/Orcish_spear "Orcish spear"), an [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield"), and an [orcish bow](/wiki/Orcish_bow "Orcish bow") and stack of 3–14 [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison") [orcish arrows](/wiki/Orcish_arrow "Orcish arrow").

### EvilHack

In EvilHack, goblin outriders will always generate [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") atop [wolves](/wiki/Wolves "Wolves").

## Strategy

While not a serious threat by itself, the goblin outrider's steed and numbers can be a concerning threat, especially if they are equipped with some form of ranged attack.

## Encyclopedia entry

Now goblins are cruel, wicked, and bad-hearted. They make  
no beautiful things, but they make many clever ones. They  
can tunnel and mine as well as any but the most skilled  
dwarves, when they take the trouble, though they are usually  
untidy and dirty. Hammers, axes, swords, daggers, pickaxes,  
tongs, and also instruments of torture, they make very well,  
or get other people to make to their design, prisoners and  
slaves that have to work till they die for want of air and  
light.  
\[ The Hobbit, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]
html:
Goblin outrider

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
o goblin outrider (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 2d4
o goblin outrider (No tile)
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 2d4

Base level 4
Base experience 22
Speed 10
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 2, appears in small groups
Genocidable Yes
Weight 400
Nutritional value 100
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed None

A goblin outrider:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 905

A goblin outrider, o, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is somewhat stronger than a regular goblin.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 EvilHack
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly-generated goblin-outriders can generate in small groups, and may be peaceful towards orcish characters.

A goblin outrider has a 1⁄3 chance each of being generated with of the following: an orcish cloak, a stack of orcish spears, an orcish shield, and an orcish bow and stack of 3–14 poisoned orcish arrows.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, goblin outriders will always generate riding atop wolves.

Strategy

While not a serious threat by itself, the goblin outrider's steed and numbers can be a concerning threat, especially if they are equipped with some form of ranged attack.

Encyclopedia entry

Now goblins are cruel, wicked, and bad-hearted. They make
no beautiful things, but they make many clever ones. They
can tunnel and mine as well as any but the most skilled
dwarves, when they take the trouble, though they are usually
untidy and dirty. Hammers, axes, swords, daggers, pickaxes,
tongs, and also instruments of torture, they make very well,
or get other people to make to their design, prisoners and
slaves that have to work till they die for want of air and
light.
[ The Hobbit, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]

A '''goblin outrider''', {{cyan|o}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is somewhat stronger than a regular [[goblin]].

==Generation==
Randomly-generated goblin-outriders can generate in small [[group]]s, and may be peaceful towards [[Orc (starting race)|orcish]] characters.

A goblin outrider has a {{frac|3}} chance each of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] of the following: an [[orcish cloak]], a stack of [[orcish spear]]s, an [[orcish shield]], and an [[orcish bow]] and stack of {{rn1|12|3}} [[poison]]ed [[orcish arrow]]s.

===EvilHack===
In EvilHack, goblin outriders will always generate [[riding]] atop [[wolves]].

==Strategy==
While not a serious threat by itself, the goblin outrider's steed and numbers can be a concerning threat, especially if they are equipped with some form of ranged attack.

==Encyclopedia entry==
